definition: knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]

sentences.english: Hast thou not milked me as milk, and curdled me like cheese?
sentences.chinese: 所有的奶酪都来自凝结的牛奶。

sentences.english: The investigation of enhanced condensation heat transfer had been conducted on the outside vertical Titanium circularly-grooved tube.
sentences.chinese: 对钛波槽管进行了垂直管外凝结换热的实验研究。

sentences.english: Moisture in the atmosphere condensed into dew during the night.
sentences.chinese: 大气中的水分在夜间凝结成露珠。

sentences.english: Researchers say the water dilutes the blood, making it less likely to clot.
sentences.chinese: 研究人员说，水可以稀释血液，使之不易发生凝结。

sentences.english: The reed is exhuberant frosted with the crystal white dew.
sentences.chinese: 芦苇初生青青，白色露水凝结为霜。

sentences.english: The effects of the condensing layer of the cryopanel on the cryopump capabilities were analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 分析了液氦低温板的凝结层对低温泵性能的影响。

sentences.english: How do you manage to instil teamwork in a squad packed with great individual talents?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎样让一群天才球员凝结成一支冠军团队的？

sentences.english: It is so soundless . Air nearby liked be condensed.
sentences.chinese: 周围的空气如凝结了一般，是那么的寂静。

sentences.english: And re-condense it, and make a new liquid.
sentences.chinese: 然后重新凝结，得到液体。

sentences.english: The degree of supercooling of condensate influences greatly the safe and economic operation performance of units.
sentences.chinese: 凝结水过冷度对机组的安全和经济运行有重要的影响。

sentences.english: The cold wind condenses vapor into rain.
sentences.chinese: 冷风使水蒸汽凝结成雨。

sentences.english: No condensation, resistant to dew formation.
The blood coagulates to stop wounds bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 血液凝结，使伤口不再出血。

sentences.english: Steam is condensed to water when it touches a cold surface.
sentences.chinese: 蒸汽触及冷的表面即凝结成水。

sentences.english: The bones of his rib cage were exposed, and deeper, black congealing blood pooled.
sentences.chinese: 他胸腔的骨头开放了，很深，黑色的凝结血形成血塘。

sentences.english: The fermentation of milk causes it to curdle .

definition: to condense/to coagulate/coacervation (i.e. form tiny droplets)/aggregation/coherent
to freeze/to solidify/to congeal/fig. with rapt attention
variant of 凝練|凝练[ning2 lian4]
to melt/to thaw/to dissolve/to blend into/to combine/to fuse
